medium: Brush and brown wash with pen and brown ink on cream laid paper
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895

makers.displaydate: 1591–1666; born Cento, Italy; died Bologna, Italy
makers.displaymaker: Guercino (Giovanni Francesco Barbieri), 1591–1666; born Cento, Italy; died Bologna, Italy

texts.textentryhtml:
Lord Northwick collection (likely preceded by Casa Gennari-John Bouverie-Christopher Hervey or Elizabeth Bouverie); Rt. Hon. Sir John Rushout, 4th Bt., or John Rushout, 5th Bt. and 1st Lord Northwick, and thence by descent; their sale, Sotheby’s, London, November 18, 1919, lots 1–120, or November 1, 1920, lots 3–28 and 93–98; William Bateson, stamp (L. 2604a) recto, lower right, in black; his sale, Sotheby’s, London, April 23–24, 1929; where acquired by E. Parsons & Sons, London, 1929; purchased from Parsons in 1929 (see inscription) by Dan Fellows Platt, stamps (L. 750a and 2066b) verso, lower left on mount, in blue.;


Dated 1630’s (DiGrazia);
